I don't get it... Why does everyone always seem to be so turned off that it takes two "CD's" to burn it. Why don't you just burn it to a DVD and put it on the television?? Just wondering...

@JBNyen:  
(and anyone else who doesn't know this):

The reason for the "2 CD" size is because of the AC3 - 5.1 Dolby Audio CODEC  that is used here - instead of an MP3 - 2 channel audio track.

If you've got a decent surround-sound setup, it makes a world of difference.
I used to seek smaller rips (1 CD size), but since acquiring "Home Theater" equipment, I now prefer the original 5.1 audio.
(AAC works ok, too - used on BluRay (MKV)rips)
